name: Salted Caramel Ice Cream
instructions: In a saucepan or microwave-safe bowl, combine cream, milk, sugar, and corn syrup. Gently heat and stir until the sugar dissolves. Do not boil.
Stir in vanilla extract, salt, and optional alcohol.
Cool to room temperature, then pour into a Ninja Creami pint container. Freeze for at least 24 hours until solid.
After freezing, let the pint sit at room temperature for 10 minutes.
Run the Lite Ice Cream or Gelato cycle.
If crumbly, add 1–2 tablespoons of whole milk and run the Re-spin cycle.
Make a well in the center and add the caramel sauce. Run the Mix-In cycle.
If the ice cream is too soft after the Mix-In, return it to the freezer for 30–60 minutes before serving.

storage_tips.freezing_cup: Store leftover ice cream in the Creami pint container or transfer to a shallow airtight container for easier scooping.
storage_tips.softening: Let sit at room temperature for 5–10 minutes before re-spinning if storing long-term.
